metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15395 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.62 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page, aka an ImageCapture NULL pointer dereference.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15395` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380').
